newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish March consumer confidence falls slightly.
newsitem.headline: Finnish March consumer confidence falls slightly.

text.p: Finnish consumer confidence was little changed in March, easing to 15.6 points from 15.9 points in February, Statistics Finland (SF) said in a statement on Thursday.
"Finns' confidence in the economy remained strong in March according to Statistics Finland's consumer confidence indicator," it said.

Consumer confidence is measured as the average of estimates on five variables: personal finances in the past year and coming year, the Finnish economy in the past and the coming year, and how advantageous it is to buy durable goods. @
The consumer confidence indicator was 15.5 points in January, 13.8 points in December and November and 14.2 points in September.
